docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO -- It began last Sunday evening when two groups of young, well-mannered and heavily armed men took over two little homes that stand back to back on a block next to Punta Carretas prison here.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO -- It began last Sunday evening when two groups of young, well-mannered and heavily armed men took over two little homes that stand back to back on a block next to Punta Carretas prison here.
docs.abstract: Tupamaro moves revd; group apparently specializes in controlled use of illegal armed force for long-range pol goals; leader Sendic helped found Tupamaros 8 yrs ago after Socialist party he organized lost in elections; tunnels used in mass escape illus

headline.main: A Strategy Of Long, Dangerous Political Warfare; Tupamaros:

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 11 -- President Jorge Pacheco Areco, whose Government was undermined this week by successes of the urban guerrillas called Tupamaros, today promised to become even tougher in his battle against them.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 11 -- President Jorge Pacheco Areco, whose Government was undermined this week by successes of the urban guerrillas called Tupamaros, today promised to become even tougher in his battle against them.
docs.abstract: Pacheco pledges tougher stand in battle against Tupamaros, assuming personal responsibility for future Uruguayan Govt decisions in fighting guerrillas and econ decline, radio-TV s; contends rules of dem insts have handicapped Govt

headline.main: URUGUAY'S LEADER WARNS ON REBELS; Pacheco Tells Nation He'll Take a Tougher Stand

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to the New York Times

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 15 -- Four Roman Catholic priests were convicted of subversion last night by a Brazilian military court and sentenced to prison terms ranging from six months to four years.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Sept. 15 -- Four Roman Catholic priests were convicted of subversion last night by a Brazilian military court and sentenced to prison terms ranging from six months to four years.
docs.abstract: 4 RC priests convicted of subversion, Sao Paulo; are charged with having helped men wanted by police to escape across border to Uruguay

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LONDON, Sept. 16 -- Sir Geoffrey Jackson, the British Ambassador to Uruguay, said today he hoped that by now the Tupamaro urban guerrillas had "found this business of ambassador-snatching counter-productive and self-defeating."
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 16 -- Sir Geoffrey Jackson, the British Ambassador to Uruguay, said today he hoped that by now the Tupamaro urban guerrillas had "found this business of ambassador-snatching counter-productive and self-defeating."
docs.abstract: Brit Amb Jackson describes ordeal, news conf, London; hopes Tupamaros will have found 'ambassador-snatching' counterproductive and self-defeating; says kidnappers look like Ku Klux Klan men in their masks and are about univ age; terms conditions of his confinement, 'physically abominable,' but says captors provided him with books to read; believes they would have killed him if there had been attempt at rescue by security forces; evades questions about pol situation in Uruguay

headline.main: BRITON RECOUNTS LATIN KIDNAPPING; Envoy Tells of Eight-Month Captivity by Tupamaros

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 22 -- The United States today lost the first skirmish in its campaign to prevent the expulsion of the Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan from the United Nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Sept. 22 -- The United States today lost the first skirmish in its campaign to prevent the expulsion of the Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan from the United Nations.

headline.main: U.S. LOSES ROUND IN U.N. docs.snippet: MINEOLA, L. I. -- "Colores Magicos," a sound-and-light composition, will be the featured piece when the Orchestra Da Camera, Long Island's youth-oriented chamber ensemble, opens its 14th season in the Brentwood public schools on Oct. 4.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINEOLA, L. I. -- "Colores Magicos," a sound-and-light composition, will be the featured piece when the Orchestra Da Camera, Long Island's youth-oriented chamber ensemble, opens its 14th season in the Brentwood public schools on Oct. 4.
docs.abstract: Orchestra Da Camera: Orchestra Da Camera, formed in '58, discussed; plans over 700 performances throughout Long Island ps system during '71 season; Mineola system provides free space, rehearsal and performing areas and secretarial help; orch's aim is to involve youth in musical experiences

headline.main: Orchestra Da Camera Opens Season With Light and Sound Work

byline.original: By HARRY ZLOKOWERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: PALO ALTO, Calif., Sept. 25 -- A new birth control method, whose developers expect it to have no side effects, is being tested on 1,000 women in the United States and Mexico.
docs.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif., Sept. 25 -- A new birth control method, whose developers expect it to have no side effects, is being tested on 1,000 women in the United States and Mexico.
docs.abstract: Dr A Zafferoni (Alza Corp) designs method of introducing drugs into body through skin; drugs will bypass liver, avoiding much metabolic degradation, and work more efficiently for each individual; method described

headline.main: New Method of Birth Control Being Tested by U.S. and Mexican Women
